alert.note: Alert for Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 3:24PM MST until July 12 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Arizona, including the following counties, in east central Arizona, Gila. In northeast Arizona, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Firebox Creek, Rock Creek, Bull Creek, Bog Creek, Big Bonito Creek, Trout Creek, Paradise Creek, Cottonwood Canyon, Diamond Creek, Show Low Creek, Sharp Creek, Crooked Creek, West Turkey Creek, No Name Creek, Corn Creek, East Fork White River, Pine Creek, East Cedar Creek, Bear Flat Creek, Little Bonito Creek, Turkey Creek, Willow Creek, Bear Canyon, Sun Creek, Walnut Creek, Burnt Corral Creek, Forestdale Creek, Little Bog Creek, Lone Pine Creek, Sand Creek, Coon Creek, Sweater Creek, Nash Creek, Cedar Creek, North Fork Diamond Creek, Gooseberry Creek, Coyote Creek, Earl Creek, Billy Creek, North Fork White River, Corduroy Creek, Horseshoe Creek, Thompson Creek, Little Diamond Creek, Deep Creek, K L Creek and Tonto Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pinetop-lakeside, Rainbow City, Whiteriver, Turkey Creek, Seven Mile, Fort Apache, North Fork, Hondah, Fort Apache Reservation, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, East Fork, Canyon Day, Mcnary, Pinetop Country Club and White Mountain Apache Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 352 and 371. Highway 60 between mile markers 330 and 332. State Route 73 between mile markers 328 and 357. State Route 473 between mile markers 0 and 10. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
